posts.post_content: Tibalt in the back hiding in the shadows with his creepy face is awesome, but the blightning effect on the face, pouring out of his fingers, pales in comparison to the cynical touch of the original art. That bleak dark skull with smoke and lightning etching out of it epitomized the cruelty of hitting for a solid 3 for 3 CMC and then punishing them further with two discards. This art makes Blightning look like Mini-Blightning, as if it's doing only 2 damage and 1 discard.
posts.html:
Tibalt in the back hiding in the shadows with his creepy face is awesome, but the blightning effect on the face, pouring out of his fingers, pales in comparison to the cynical touch of the original art. That bleak dark skull with smoke and lightning etching out of it epitomized the cruelty of hitting for a solid 3 for 3 CMC and then punishing them further with two discards. This art makes Blightning look like Mini-Blightning, as if it's doing only 2 damage and 1 discard.

Posted By: SyntheticDreamer (3/19/2013 9:32:45 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
**(Art comparison rant)**  
  
While the old artwork seemed to be more focused on the black aspect with the "memory loss",  
this new artwork is more focused on the burn from the red aspect.  
  
In my opinion, the old one was already somewhat iconic and is easily distinguishable from other cards,  
which is probably the reason why most people tend to prefer that one.  
  
But the new one is just as great:  
It seems the memory loss is induced here by the severe pain from melting that poor guy's freaking face!  
And you still see that the burns aren't caused by flames but by lightning, so it's still true to the card's name.  
Also, we get to see [Tibalt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tibalt) enjoying what he does best - which i think is forcefully sharing his madness with others.
posts.html:
(Art comparison rant)

While the old artwork seemed to be more focused on the black aspect with the "memory loss",
this new artwork is more focused on the burn from the red aspect.

In my opinion, the old one was already somewhat iconic and is easily distinguishable from other cards,
which is probably the reason why most people tend to prefer that one.

But the new one is just as great:
It seems the memory loss is induced here by the severe pain from melting that poor guy's freaking face!
And you still see that the burns aren't caused by flames but by lightning, so it's still true to the card's name.
Also, we get to see Tibalt enjoying what he does best - which i think is forcefully sharing his madness with others.
